obs_id.title: Programmatic observation identifier
obs_id.description:
An example of the OBS_ID and related keywords -
OBS_ID = 'V80600013001P0000000002101' / Programmatic observation identifier
VISIT_ID= '80600013001' / Visit identifier
PROGRAM = '80600 ' / Program number
OBSERVTN= '013 ' / Observation number
VISIT = '001 ' / Visit number
VISITGRP= '02 ' / Visit group identifier
SEQ_ID = '1 ' / Parallel sequence identifier
ACT_ID = '01 ' / Activity identifier
EXPOSURE= '1 ' / Exposure request number
visit_id = Program number + Observation number + Visit number

The OBS_ID = 'V' + visit_id + 'P' + parallel-program number + parallel-observation number + visit group identifier + parallel sequence identifier + activity_identifier.

The eight characters after the 'P' are only populated with non-zero values of the parallel program number and observation number if the exposure is a parallel. Parallel observations occur in the same visit as the prime observation, so the visit number is not needed after the 'P'. For a prime exposure with one or more exposures executing in parallel, only the prime program number and observation number will be populated. For a parallel exposure, both the prime program number / observation number and the parallel program number / observation number will be populated.

The exposure_id is not included in the OBS_ID. It is a separate field in the science image header of the ssr file.

Some of the nomenclature is confusing, especially the over use of observation in programmatic observation identifier and observation number.

visit_id.title: Visit identifier
visit_id.description: The eleven character visit_id, <PPPPP><OOO><VVV>, uniquely indentifies the visit and consists of the program, observation and visit destinations. This visit_id is explicitly embedded in the file name and also included in the Science Image header and footer in the Recorded Science Data file

program_number.title: Program number
program_number.description: The program number is a 5 character number that indentifies the prime proposal. It is found in the visit, program, and observation IDs

observation_number.title: Observation number
observation_number.description: The observation number is three character number that specifies an observation within a parallel proposal (note: large numbers of observations are expected per proposal). The observation number is found in both the visit and observation IDs.

visit_number.title: Visit number
visit_number.description: The visit number is a three character number that indentifies the visit within an observation. Multiple visits per observation are needed for mosaics and some long observations. Note fields that trace back to the proposal are called numbers rather than IDs to emphasize that only decimal numbers can be used. The visit number can be found in both the visit, program and observation IDs.

observation_label.title: Proposer label for the observation
observation_label.description: Proposer (users defined) label for the observation

observation_folder.title: Name of the APT observation folder
observation_folder.description: The name of the APT observation folder in which this observation is contained.
